questions:
Q1: What is Brian Kennedy's current occupation?
A1: Brian Kennedy is a gallery director.

Q2: Where did Brian Kennedy work before joining the Peabody Essex Museum? A2: Before joining the Peabody Essex Museum, Brian Kennedy worked at the Toledo Museum of Art and the Hood Museum of Art.

Q3: What was the reason for Brian Kennedy's resignation from the Peabody Essex Museum? A3: According to the passage, Brian Kennedy resigned from the Peabody Essex Museum in December 2019 due to personal reasons.

Q4: How long did Brian Kennedy work at the National Gallery of Australia? A4: According to the passage, Brian Kennedy worked at the National Gallery of Australia from 1997 to 2005, for about eight years.

Q5: What was the focus of Brian Kennedy's art education efforts at the Toledo Museum of Art? A5: The passage states that Brian Kennedy focused the museum's art education efforts on visual literacy, which he defines as "learning to read, understand and write visual language."

Q6: What were some of the major acquisitions made by the Toledo Museum of Art during Brian Kennedy's tenure? A6: The passage mentions that works by Frank Stella, Sean Scully, Jaume Plensa, Ravinder Reddy, and Mary Sibande have been acquired by the Toledo Museum of Art during Brian Kennedy's tenure.

Q7: How long did Brian Kennedy work at the Hood Museum of Art? A7: According to the passage, Brian Kennedy worked at the Hood Museum of Art from July 2005 to 2019, for about fourteen years.

Q8: What was the reason for the return of several objects from the Toledo Museum of Art's collection? A8: The passage states that the objects were returned due to claims that they were stolen and/or illegally exported prior to being sold to the museum.

Q9: How many objects does the Hood Museum of Art have in its collection? A9: According to the passage, the Hood Museum of Art has one of the largest collections on any American college or university campus, with over 70,000 objects.

Q10: What was the focus of Brian Kennedy's curatorial work at the Hood Museum of Art? A10: The passage mentions that Brian Kennedy curated several exhibitions at the Hood Museum of Art, including "Wenda Gu: Forest of Stone Steles: Retranslation and Rewriting Tang Dynasty Poetry," "Sean Scully: The Art of the Stripe," and "Frank Stella: Irregular Polygons."

Q1: What is the name of the film directed by Robert Dornhelm in 1991?
A1: Requiem für Dominik (Requiem for Dominic)

Q2: Which awards did the film get selected for?
A2: The film was selected as the Austrian entry for the Best Foreign Language Film at the 63rd Academy Awards, but was not accepted as a nominee.

Q3: Who are the main cast members of the film?
A3: Georg Hoffmann-Ostenhof, Georg Metzenrad, Felix Mitterer, Werner Prinz, Antonia Rados, August Schmölzer, and Nikolas Vogel.

Q4: How many submissions did Austria make for the Best Foreign Language Film category at the 63rd Academy Awards?
A4: Austria submitted Requiem für Dominik as their entry for the category.

Q5: Can you name any other films that were selected as the Austrian entry for the Best Foreign Language Film category at the Academy Awards?
A5: Yes, Requiem für Dominik is one of the films that Austria has submitted for the category.

A6: Austria has submitted a film for the category multiple times, but the exact number is not specified in the passage.

A7: Robert Dornhelm is the director of Requiem für Dominik.

Q8: In what year was Requiem für Dominik released?
A8: Requiem für Dominik was released in 1991.

Q9: Can you give a brief summary of the film's plot?
A9: Requiem für Dominik is a drama film that tells the story of a man named Dominic who dies and his friends and family deal with his death.

A10: Requiem für Dominik was not accepted as a nominee for the Best Foreign Language Film category at the 63rd Academy Awards.

Q1: Who is Antony Dominic?
A1: Antony Dominic is a former Chief Justice of the High Court of Kerala and the current Chairman of the State Human Rights Commission of Kerala.

Q2: When was Antony Dominic born?
A2: Antony Dominic was born on May 30, 1956.

Q3: What is the name of the law college where Antony Dominic obtained his degree in law?
A3: Antony Dominic obtained his degree in law from S.D.M. Law College in Mangalore.

Q4: In which year did Antony Dominic start his practice in Munsiff's Court and JFCM?
A4: Antony Dominic started his practice in Munsiff's Court and JFCM in 1981.

Q5: In which year was Antony Dominic appointed Additional Judge of the Kerala High Court?
A5: Antony Dominic was appointed Additional Judge of the Kerala High Court in January 2007.

Q6: When was Antony Dominic promoted to a Permanent Judge of the Kerala High Court?
A6: Antony Dominic was promoted to a Permanent Judge of the Kerala High Court in December 2008.

Q7: When did Antony Dominic become the Chief Justice of the High Court of Kerala?
A7: Antony Dominic became the Chief Justice of the High Court of Kerala on February 6, 2018.

Q8: How long did Antony Dominic serve as the Chief Justice of the High Court of Kerala?
A8: Antony Dominic served as the Chief Justice of the High Court of Kerala from February 6, 2018 to May 29, 2018.

Q9: What is the current position of Antony Dominic?
A9: Currently, Antony Dominic is the Chairman of the State Human Rights Commission of Kerala.

Q10: Can you provide more information about Antony Dominic's education and career?
A10: Of course! Antony Dominic obtained his degree in law from S.D.M. Law College in Mangalore, and he started his practice in Munsiff's Court and JFCM in 1981. He was appointed Additional Judge of the Kerala High Court in January 2007 and promoted to a Permanent Judge in December 2008. He served as the Chief Justice of the High Court of Kerala from February 6, 2018 to May 29, 2018, before becoming the Chairman of the State Human Rights Commission of Kerala.

Q11: What is the name of the state where Antony Dominic served as Chief Justice?
A11: Antony Dominic served as the Chief Justice of the High Court of Kerala, which is located in the Indian state of Kerala.

Q12: How many years did Antony Dominic serve as Chief Justice of the High Court of Kerala?
A12: Antony Dominic served as the Chief Justice of the High Court of Kerala for approximately one year, from February 6, 2018 to May 29, 2018.

Q13: Can you provide more details about Antony Dominic's experience in Company, Labour and Constitutional laws?
A13: Certainly! Antony Dominic acquired extensive experience in Company, Labour and Constitutional laws during his practice as a lawyer and later as a judge of the Kerala High Court. He has expertise in handling complex legal matters related to these areas.

Q14: What is the current status of Antony Dominic's tenure as Chairman of the State Human Rights Commission of Kerala?
A14: Antony Dominic is currently serving as the Chairman of the State Human Rights Commission of Kerala, a position he has held since [insert date].
